I feel there must be a way to do this... given func( foo => 1, bar => 2 ); how to write my ( $foo, $bar ) = .... inside the function?
My current attempt is my ( $foo, $bar ) = @{{@_}}{qw( foo bar )}; which is messy as sin
LeoNerd: I'd change specs to be func({ foo => 1, bar => 2})
Leonerd: If you insist on doing it on one line, that's about as good as it gets. But why not use a temporary hash ? Should be just as fast and as readable
Hrm.. :/ Then it's only marginally nicer as my ( $foo, $bar ) = @{$_[0]}{qw( foo bar )};
my %args = @_; my ( $foo, $bar ) = @args{qw( foo bar )}; ya... that works
if you combine it with a delete you can then check if %args is empty and catch typos or unexpected arguments....
Oh, args won't be empty... this is a wrapper function that pulls a few named args off and sends the rest to a nested inner function

Ya.. but this is a plain function
I suppose "iterate" is about as best as I'll get

meta.title: How to name a new Flickr-module

body.saying: trying to come up with a replacement name for my Flickr::Simple2.. (it is based off of XML::Simple rather than XML::Parser::Lite::Tree) - Net::Flickr, Flickr::API, Flickr::Simple are already taken. Any ideas? I'm coming up blank for a name
It is a Perl interface to Flickr
jfroebe: ah, I saw your message on Chicago.pm
you found others and decided you needed to make ANOTHER perl interface to flickr?
the other ones have been broken for a long time (either because of use of the abandoned XML::Parser::Lite::Tree module or because the authentication method was never correctly implemented)
jfroebe: Please no more names involving ::Simple
hah tiny is the new simple
mofino.. that's the problem what to name it
that should be small enough and it sounds serious
jfroebe: a Rose by any other name...
I think half the posts to module-authors are about "How shall I name this module?"
jfroebe: I'm not a fan of XML::Simple either.
"this could be an arrayref or a hashref or a nothingref depending on how many thingies were in your doo-dad"
but yeah, that is a bit annoying
XML::Simple is the MySQL of XML parsers.
There's a reason it's called "Simple." You'll find out about 3 days after you start using it.
would it be anything releated to being feature-incomplete
That would be be why it's "simple".
but for simple XML data (i.e. Flickr's REST API), it is more than sufficient
mofino - now you see.. all the good ones are taken ;-)
maybe you had it at Flickr::Simple2
jfroebe, since your API is an improvement over Simple
jfroebe: you can call it Flickr::Jfroebey
mofino, I think you might be right.
rindolf - lol ... my head is already big enough lol
jfroebe, i mean, if that's what it is, it shows a clear progression from Simple
( Flicker::API::FAFINAFA is not a flickr api )
jfroebe: I have released Spork::Shlomify with some random changes to Spork that I needed.
Well, I use subclassing to implement them.
apeiron: it's not a fork! It's an improved spork!
that way somebody will be able to invent something better next year
Flickr::3b0f3a25d07e5d9dbdf98db15ee70410 (and no, it is not random)
thanks guys :) I've requested the Flickr::Simple2 namespace via pause

info.tagline: "A rose by any other name…" (and a little on XML::Simple)
